alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Harrison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HARRISON AND CENTRAL FLOYD COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Corydon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Albany, Galena, Lanesville, Crandall, Byrneville, Bradford, Floyds Knobs, Lottick Corner, New Salisbury and Bridgeport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
